UI_visible_response: : Huang Xueqin is committed to promoting women's rights and has done a lot of work in this regard, such as focusing on gender - based violence cases, writing related articles, and accompanying community partners and victims2. In June 2024, she was sentenced to five years in prison after being found guilty of subverting state power. traffic_visible_response: 正在搜索找到 5 篇资料参考Huang Xueqin is a Chinese "MeToo" activist, women's rights activist, and independent journalist. She advocates for the following:- **Combating Sexual Harassment**: In October 2017, Huang initiated a survey on the experiences of Chinese female journalists regarding sexual harassment. The report released on March 7, 2018, based on this survey, showed that over 80% of female journalists had experienced sexual harassment, and 42.2% of the surveyed female journalists had experienced it more than once. She also supported the "MeToo" movement in China. For example, she formed an alliance with Luo Xixi to expose the sexual harassment behavior of Chen Xiaowu, a professor at Beihang University, which led to the revocation of Chen's teaching credentials and the cancellation of his "Yangtze River Scholar" title, marking the beginning of the "MeToo" movement in China.- **Promoting Women's Rights**: Huang Xueqin is committed to promoting women's rights and has done a lot of work in this regard, such as focusing on gender - based violence cases, writing related articles, and accompanying community partners and victims. She hopes to raise public awareness of women's rights issues and improve the social environment for women.Huang Xueqin was arrested in 2019 on suspicion of "picking quarrels and provoking trouble" and again in 2021 on suspicion of "inciting subversion of state power". In June 2024, she was sentenced to five years in prison after being found guilty of subverting state power. Her supporters maintain that she is innocent and that her actions are aimed at promoting social progress and improving the legal system.
